item.title: Black Ops 7 Doesn’t Have Wall Run Due to Its Timeline
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7’s associate creative director has explained why the timeline doesn’t allow for Wall Runs.

Activision’s latest Call of Duty installment, Black Ops 7, is all set to arrive on November 14, 2025, with the developers conducting open beta testing until October 9. Ahead of the game’s release, the devs have provided players with an insight into BO7’s movement features, explaining why Wall Jumps can transition into Wall Runs.

Black Ops 7 Doesn’t Have Wall Runs As the Timeline Doesn’t Allow It

During a new interview with GamesRadar+, Black Ops 7 associate creative director Miles Leslie revealed why Wall Runs weren’t included in the game. Leslie first explains that when they began developing BO7, they “wanted to pick up threads from Black Ops 2.” Which is why all the technology available in the game is from that era. Leslie explained that the team is very precious to their canon and they have to respect that.

Leslie added that they couldn’t have Thrust Jump as the tech didn’t exist until 2035. Similar to that, Wall Run would have made sense if the game were set more in the future; however, as the tech did not exist in the Black Ops 2 era, “so it made sense not to do it.”

Black Ops 7 does have Wall Jumps, which allow players to gain some height by chaining three jumps. Leslie also spoke about how players can get much higher with the new feature, and they “took a lot of learnings from everything we did on Black Ops 3 – it was really important that we kept the combat in-frame.”

item.title: Today’s Wordle #1572: Hints And Answer For October 8, 2025
item.content:encoded:
Wordle challenges players to guess a fresh five-letter word each day in six tries or fewer. Whether you’re a beginner or a daily player, today’s tips and strategies can help you solve it faster and maintain your streak—if you’re open to a little extra help. So, if you’ve found yourself stuck with today’s Wordle, don’t worry, below you’ll find some helpful hints and even the answer for Wordle Game #1572 for October 8, 2025.

To play today’s Wordle, head to the game’s website. If you just want to go right to today’s answer without any tips or tricks, you can click right here. If you’ve missed any days, check out our Wordle Answer Archive for every past answer.

IMPORTANT: The following information includes spoilers on today’s and yesterday’s editions of Wordle. If you don’t want the answer given to you, stop scrolling.

How To Play Wordle

Wordle is a simple but addictive word puzzle. Each day, players have to guess a five-letter word answer in no more than six attempts. After each guess:

  • Green letters are correct and in the right position.
  • Yellow letters are correct, but in the wrong position.
  • Gray letters are not in the word at all.

The goal is to guess the word in as few tries as possible. Daily puzzles keep players coming back for more, making it a fun brain exercise and a trending topic online.

Wordle can only be played on the New York Times website. There currently isn’t an app for you to download the official game.

Wordle Hints For Today, October 8, 2025

The Wordle answer for game #1572 is going to give you a challenge, though it’s not the toughest word to get. According to the NY Times Wordle review, today’s answer takes an average of 4.3 guesses out of 6 to get. That makes it quite easier than October 7’s 6-guess average. Still, it won’t be a piece of cake for players.

General Wordle Hints For October 8

Without giving today’s Wordle answer completely away, here are a few helpful hints for today to get you started:

  • Hint 1: This word contains a repeated letter.
  • Hint 2: It ends with Y.
  • Hint 3: It describes something that gets under your skin (figuratively).
  • Hint 4: It means to irritate or bother someone.

Use these clues to narrow down your guesses and increase your chances of solving Wordle #1572 for October 8, 2025

Starter Words For October 8, 2025

If you just want help getting started without having today’s Wordle answer given to you, there are a few starter words worth trying that will help you figure out some included letters. A few starter words that may help are:

  • LOYAL
  • NANNY
  • NYLON
  • ANNEX

Today’s Wordle Answer For Game #1572 On October 8, 2025

If you’ve tried everything, including using the above hints, and are still stuck, you can find the answer to today’s Wordle below.

Answer: ANNOY

If you solved today’s Wordle without our answer, congratulations! If not, take note of the best tips above for tomorrow’s puzzle, and check back daily for more hints.

Yesterday’s Wordle Answer

If you missed the previous game, here’s yesterday’s Wordle answer for Game #1571 on October 7, 2025:

Answer: NYLON

While not always the case, looking at previous words can sometimes give you insight into common patterns or letter usage in Wordle puzzles. Reminder, you can check out every past Wordle answer in our official archive.

When Is The Next Wordle Game After #1572?

Wordle games are updated daily at 12am or Midnight in your respective time zone. Information about the next game is often available in the hours before to give players a heads up. The game on October 9 will be Wordle Game #1573.

What Is Wordle?

Wordle is a daily word puzzle created by Josh Wardle. Initially developed as a prototype in 2013, it wasn’t fully released until 2021. The game tasks players with guessing a five-letter word in six tries or fewer, using hints from each attempt to narrow down the answer. Its straightforward concept, accessibility, and the thrill of solving a new puzzle each day helped it surge in popularity by late 2021. The success of Wordle inspired numerous spin-offs and social media challenges, leading to its acquisition by The New York Times in early 2022.

item.title: Black Ops 7 Beta Has Been Extended
item.content:encoded:
Call of Duty: Black Ops 7’s Beta has received an extension and will now end on October 9, 2025.

Activision is hosting an open beta for Call of Duty: Black Ops 7, allowing players to test the game and provide feedback before its release on November 14, 2025. The developers have now decided to extend the testing period for some, allowing even more players to join the beta and provide more concrete feedback.

Black Ops 7 Beta Now Ends on October 9

Announced through a new post on X (formerly Twitter) by Treyarch, the Call of Duty: Black Ops 7 beta has a new end date, scheduled to conclude at 9:00 a.m. PT on Thursday, October 9. The developers have stated that 2XP + 2X Weapon XP has also been extended through the beta, allowing more players to reach level 30. This, in turn, will enable them to explore a broader range of weapons, gear, attachments, and Overclocks.

Moreover, the extended Black Ops 7 beta will feature the following multiplayer maps: Toshin (NEW), Blackheart, Cortex, Exposure, Imprint, and The Forge. Zombies mode will feature Vandorn Farm. In playlists, multiplayer will include Open Moshpit, Moshpit, Open Hardcore Moshpit, Search & Destroy (NEW), and Training Course. Zombies’ playlists will consist of Survival and Training Course.

Lastly, the following modes will be available in the extension: Team Deathmatch (Core + Hardcore), Domination (Core + Hardcore), Hardpoint, Kill Confirmed, Overload, and Search & Destroy. Interested readers can check out the full patch notes here.
